text:
Hi All,
I am facing an issue with serverless api in HubSpot CMS.

I am calling a serverless API when a form is submitted in HubSpot CMS. One of the strangers got this flow by inspecting the browser and calling it as an API from one of their tools. It was like conitnously I got 950+ requests.

How can I avoid these things in future?

Thanks

1. Hi Selva, Use authentication: Implement authentication mechanisms such as OAuth or API keys to ensure that only authorized users can access your API.
2. Use encryption: Use encryption to protect sensitive data that is transmitted over the network.
3. Validate input: Validate all input to your API to prevent injection attacks and other types of security vulnerabilities.
4. Monitor your API: Monitor your API for suspicious activity and unusual traffic patterns.
5. Keep your software up to date: Keep your serverless function and any dependencies up to date with the latest security patches and updates     <https://blog.HubSpot.com/website/api-security>
is running backend tasks on a schedule something that serverless-functions can help with or is that not a thing?
Currently Cron serverless functions aren't supported
but you could setup a scheduled workflow that runs a custom code action
that's out of budget at the moment
I'll have to think of something else
you could also trigger the functions on a schedule using some like zapier or make
but that's definitely not the cleanest thing
